feed.title: SAP Community - SAP HANA Cloud
feed.subtitle: SAP HANA Cloud Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: The HANA changes seem to disappear
entry.content: In our CAPM project, both the HANA team and CAPM team are developing artifacts in the same HANA repository. However, whenever we build and deploy the MTA.yaml from the CAPM side, the HANA changes seem to disappear. Why does this happen, and what is the best approach to prevent overwriting or losing HANA artifacts during CAPM deployment?”

entry.title: How to clone a CAP based solution from one HANA Cloud Database to another?
entry.content:
Hello experts,

If you wanted to copy a CAP based solution between environments (e.g. PROD -> TEST) how would you do it?

Let's say you have a CAP based solution running productively and you want to clone that system into a test system. This solution is a stack consisting of 1+ CAP servers instances hosted in Cloud foundry and connected to a SAP HANA Cloud instance. Production and test are completely separate (Different HANA Cloud DBs).

Suppose both the production and test systems already exist and are working, they just have different data. We'd like to wipe the test system and repopulate it with data from the production system.

How do you typically do this? Specifically I'm looking for recommended procedures on how to do this please?

Options

One way that will work is using DB Explorer to export all the data for all the tables and then on the test DB import those files. The problem with this approach is it will require quite a lot of manual clicking, time and possibly slicing of data since it is not possible to export some tables in one go (as they are too large).

DB explorer also has an option for exporting catalog objects, but if I understand correctly, these exports bring data as well as all the scripts to create such objects on a target DB. If they were imported they would create a completely new schema/HDI on the target DB. If this is the case this is definitely not what we want.

Is there any other approach, please?
Thank you in advance!

entry.title: Cannot activate the 'flp-editor-vscode' extension because it depends on an unknown ....
entry.content:
Hi!

I've a SAP Business Application Studio  Trial account in order to practice.

I have created Full Stack Cloud Application space,
Recently I noticed in storyboard Graphical modeler is not working.
I got an error - "Cannot activate the 'flp-editor-vscode' extension because it depends on an unknown 'SAP.vscode-watt-framework-extension' extension."

npm - 10.9.2
node - v22.13.1

Could you please help me?

Thank you in advance,

entry.title: JPK_KR_PD G/L Account mapping
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I'm currently having doubts about the way to make the mapping of G/L Accounts with financial tags and income tax tags

1/ According to our system settings, costs or revenues assigned to a single G/L Account can come from both related or unrelated parties (whereas in a standard polish solution, tow different G/L accounts would exist, according to my customer). Therefore, it seems necessary to create tow different entries in the mapping table : "G/L Account + from related entity financial tag" and "G/L Account + from other entity financial tag".

My question is : when creating the report, how will the system differentiate the "from related entities / other entities"  journal entries since they use the same G/L Account. Will the system use the "trading partner"  information to decide which mapping should be applied ? Are there other sscui settings to use for that purpose ?

2/ In the same idea, different tax codes can be assigned to transactions posted on the same G/L Account. So we have to make as many entries in the mapping table as as there are different combinations of G/L account, financial tag, and income tax tag. Is it necessary to make an additional mapping between tax codes that exist in the system and the "official" income tax tags, so that the system correctly assign the mapping to a specific journal entry ?

=> for both questions could it be usefull/necessary to create a Badi to implement dynamic determination of the tags ?

Thank you for your help,

Erwan

entry.title: Unable to create HDI container: Service broker hana-broker failed – No database available (Trial sub
entry.content:
I am working on SAP BTP Trial (Cloud Foundry) and trying to create an HDI container for my CAP project.
But whenever I run `cf create-service hana hdi-shared Test_Cap`, I get this error:

Service broker error: Service broker hana-broker failed with:
"Can not create service instance 'Test_Cap': There is no database available.
Ensure that you have a database available in space 'dev' within organization 'a4451e2etrial'."

I already checked the following:

1. SAP HANA Cloud database exists.
2. The database is in RUNNING state.
3. I deleted old HDI containers and retried.
4. I restarted the HANA DB.
5. I recreated space and tried again.
6. I checked with `cf services` and no other HDI instance is blocking.
7. Still getting the same error every time.

It seems the HANA broker is not detecting the running database in my trial account.

My environment:
- Org: a4451e2etrial
- Space: dev
- Plan: hana-cloud (trial)
- Service: hdi-shared
- Command: `cf create-service hana hdi-shared Test_Cap`

Could this be an issue with the trial subaccount or the HANA broker?
Please guide me on how to fix this or whom to contact.

Thanks!

entry.title: 2508 Embedded Steampunk: How can we create Data Provider of form object based on RAP custom app
entry.content:
Hi,

According to the 2508 Embedded Steampunk, there is new feature to create form template in the form object of ABAP Development Tools (ADT) itself.

So, I want to create a form template based on a RAP custom app that is created by Eclipse ADT.

My development steps of RAP custom app are as follow.

1. Database table

2. Data Definition and Projection View

3. Metadata Extension

4. Behavior Definition of both Data Definition and Projection View

5. Service Definition

6. Service Binding with Odata V2 - UI

7. Form Object

 

But after creating custom app, no Data Provider is not available to choose in Form Object.

And, I can’t continue the development because of this step.

 

So, if you have any idea or any experience about this, could you please share with me how can we continue to proceed?

If you have any helpful documentation or blog posts about it, I’d appreciate it if you could share them with me.

 

Thank You.

Best Regards,

Aye Chan

entry.title: Deployment Fails Due to Limited Dev Space in SAP BTP Cloud Foundry – How to Resolve?
entry.content:
Hi Team!

I am working in SAP BTP Cloud Foundry, and my application deployment is failing because the dev space quota is getting exhausted (memory, disk, or service instance limits). The error indicates that the Cloud Foundry space does not have enough available resources to complete the deployment.

Could you please guide me on:

  1. How to check the current resource usage (memory, disk, app instances, service instances) for my Cloud Foundry org/space?

  2. What steps I can take to free up space (e.g., deleting old apps or services, clearing buildpacks, etc.)?

  3. Whether it is possible to request or increase quota for the Cloud Foundry dev space, and how to do that?

  4. Any best practices to avoid running into resource limitations during deployment?

Any help or suggestions would be greatly appreciated.
Thanks!

entry.title: How to Calculate VAT for PO and get in the Standard form(MM_PUR_PURCHASE_ORDER)
entry.content: Hello experts, I’m using the PO form template MM_PUR_PURCHASE_ORDER. I need to calculate VAT at line item level, sum it up, and show the final amount including VAT in the PO PDF. I understand VAT fields exist in PO item conditions, but they are not exposed in the delivered template. Could you guide me on how to expose these fields via CDS/OData and bind them in the form template, including the calculation logic for summation? Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Updating a custom field of std app with a custom app field that is created by dev extensibility
entry.content:
Hi,

I have a custom app that is created by Developer Extensibility in Eclipse.

I also have a custom field in std app of s4hana cloud that is created by using In-App Extensibility.

When new record is created(saved) in custom app,

I would like to update the value of  that custom app field to a custom field of std app.

Is it possible to do so?

If yes, could you please share how we can do it?

 

Thank You. 

Best Regards,

Aye Chan

entry.title: Can call Custom Business Object deployed from Eclipse CDS view from Customizing Tenant
entry.content:
Hello Community,

We created a custom Business Object (BO) in Eclipse (ABAP project) and deployed it to the Development tenant (080).
However, the BAdI implementation can only be done in the Customizing tenant (100).
In the Customizing tenant, we are unable to call either the CDS view or the outbound service of the custom BO.

Is there any alternative way to access the CDS view or outbound service of the custom BO from the Customizing tenant?
If yes, please share your experience.

entry.title: SAP HANA Cloud Free Tier shows “instance already exists” but no instance is visible
entry.content:
We are working in a Pay-As-You-Go SAP BTP partner account and initially created a test SAP CAP application connected to an SAP HANA Cloud database. After deleting this setup to start fresh, we encountered an HDI container–related error while creating a new CAP application. When checking the HANA Cloud section, no database instance was visible, but attempts to create a new HANA Cloud instance consistently fail with an error indicating that an instance already exists. We tried deleting and recreating the HANA Cloud service and even removed the entire subaccount, but the same error persists, suggesting a previously provisioned HANA instance is stuck or orphaned and still consuming quota, blocking further database setup.

Error:  BrokerError, Description: You may only create one SAP HANA Cloud Free Tier instance

Main Issue

While setting up a fresh SAP CAP application, I encountered an HDI container error. When checking SAP HANA Cloud, I noticed that no HANA Cloud instance was visible, even though the system behaves as if one already exists.

What I Tried (and Failed)

  • Create a new SAP HANA Cloud instance
    → Failed with an error stating that only one instance is allowed (instance already exists)

  • Delete the HANA Cloud database and recreate everything
    → Failed (same error persists)

  • Delete the entire SAP BTP subaccount and recreate everything
    → Failed (same error still occurs)

Current Situation

It appears that an existing or orphaned HANA Cloud instance is still consuming quota, even though it is not visible or accessible, which is blocking further database setup and CAP development.

 

I would appreciate any guidance on how to clean up or reset this stuck SAP HANA Cloud instance so that we can proceed with database setup and continue CAP development.

entry.title: How to Net the invoice amount by Business Partner?
entry.content:
Hi SAP Expert,

I would like to know the way to net the invoice from the business partner.

I have 1 business partner, and the business partner has a supplier role and a customer role.

Sample

BP Code 100001 >> Supplier Invoice -1000 USD, Customer Invoice 1500 USD 

I would like to net the invoice amounts of -1,000 USD and 1,500 USD, resulting in a net balance of 500 USD on the customer side, and then post the incoming payment for the receivable amount.

Please advise.

Thanks,

May

entry.title: Cross Container Access Issue : object_owner and application user
entry.content:
Hi Experts, 

   I am working on cross container access , there are two types of roles that we define with Producer Project , one for the object_owner Role# and one for the application_user Role. We have attribute called privileges_with_grant_options, as per my knowledge , this attribute states what kind of privileges can be offered by a object_owner to application_user . 

In my project I have mentioned "SELECT" in my privileges_with_grant_options for Role# and I have mentioned "SELECT" , "INSERT" under privileges for Role.

Object Owner Role 

{
    "role":{
        "name":"EXTERNAL_ACESS_READ_G#",
        "object_privileges": [
            {
                "name":"PRODUCERNAMESPACE_PRODUCT",
                "type": "TABLE",
              
                "privileges_with_grant_option":["SELECT"] 
            }
        ]
    }
}

 Application User role 

{
    "role":{
        "name":"EXTERNAL_ACESS_READ",
        "object_privileges": [
            {
                "name":"PRODUCERNAMESPACE_PRODUCT",
                "type": "TABLE",
                "privileges": [
                    "SELECT","INSERT"
                ]
        
            }
        ]
    }
}

As per my understanding , this it should throw an error when I execute cds deploy --to hana it should throw error , stating INSERT cant be granted as there is no INSERT in  privileges_with_grant_option. Adding further Iam able to post it from Consumer app  Iam able to Post . What is the difference object_owner(schema_owner) and application_user.

Git Hub Repositories

https://github.com/Subramaniyam507/CrossHDIContainerProducer

https://github.com/Subramaniyam507/CrossHdiContainerConsumer 

Please help me with my query.

Thank you

entry.title: Initiating SAP Demo Environment
entry.content:
Dear Team,

We are new to the SAP environment. We are considering building an application that is retrieving the business data from existing SAP servers owned by our company's clients. However, after looking through the guidance and tutorials, we are still not sure about what necessary steps we should take.
Therefore, we would like to ask these questions:

  1. We want to build a demo/test environment to retrieve transaction data from SAP servers owned by our clients. Is it possible to simply call APIs from those servers from a third party App?

  2. If number 1 is not possible, could we do that by setting up Business One/BTP servers which will be called by our application (might be treated as the 3rd party apps from the SAP point of view) as bridging agent between our client's SAP server and our application? Can we have the guidance on how we set up SAP Business One/BTP demo environment servers?

  3. Also, is it possible to build a demo environment of SAP server that simulates our client's SAP server? (Please correct us if there's any misunderstanding concept regarding SAP)

Currently, we have provision SAP CLOUD PLATFORM installation and  SAP Business Technology Platform software. We are not sure whether our current setup is correct based on the aforementioned goals we have. So, we would really appreciate it if you could guide us to the correct steps. Many thanks!

entry.title: Why does SAP HANA Cloud show estimated cost in a BTP Trial account?
entry.content:
Hello everyone:

I have an SAP BTP trial account and am trying to deploy an application in Kyma using SAP HANA Cloud.
During the process, I am asked to create an SAP HANA Cloud instance, but when I do so, a pop-up window appears showing an estimated cost calculation.

My question is:
With an SAP BTP trial account, is it not possible to create an SAP HANA Cloud database instance for free without any cost?

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: SMC Campaign Execution Error Occurred
entry.content: One of my triggered Campaigns in SMC is showing Execution: "Error Occurred" and not sending. The message in the log shows "SQL error in segmentation (ADBC): A database error occurred. The error message in the database was: "maximum number of rows per table or partition reached: exceeds search result size limit: 2153744236."  How can this be fixed as it seems to be system related data issue? Restarting and pausing the campaign has not been working. It has been sending fine for over a year with no issues until a few days ago.

entry.title: Data Lake Files physical storage and Object Store in Datasphere & BDC context
entry.content:
Greetings SAP experts!

For some time I am trying to understand some concepts in regards to the Object Store and Data Lake Files physical storage in Datasphere & BDC context.

First I will start with naming the main service components of the SAP HANA Cloud that you can subscribe in SAP BTP:

  • SAP HANA Cloud, SAP HANA database
  • SAP HANA Cloud, Data Lake further formed from:
    • Data Lake Files
    • Data Lake Relational Engine

https://help.sap.com/docs/hana-cloud/sap-hana-cloud-getting-started-guide/sap-hana-cloud-components

Now let's start with SAP Datasphere

When we have a Customer Managed Space:

  • With Storage Type SAP HANA Database (Disk and In-Memory) -> I believe physical storage will be in SAP HANA Cloud, SAP HANA database on which the Datasphere tenant itself relies on.
  • When it comes to Storage Type SAP HANA Data Lake Files:
    • Where are the Data Lake Files behind the Local Table(file) physically stored?
      • In the Object Store?
        • If yes - What kind of Object Store is used?
          • SAP Managed Object Store (File Container)?
          • External Object Store (Azure Blob Storage / Azure Data Lake, AWS S3 bucket, Google Cloud Storage bucket)
      • In the SAP HANA Cloud, Data Lake Files (service component) of the SAP HAHA Cloud underlying SAP Datasphere tenant?

Further, in BDC context.

  • Let's say we activated a Data Package from BDC Cockpit, APRS starts pushing data to target HANA Data Lake Files i.e. SAP BDC Foundational services (FOS) layer.
    • Again, where are these Data Lake Files physically stored?

https://help.sap.com/docs/hana-cloud-data-lake/welcome-guide/sap-hana-cloud-data-lake-terminology

https://help.sap.com/docs/object-store/object-store-service-on-sap-btp/what-is-object-store

 

Really appreciate any input helping me to clarify these topics.

Kind regards!

entry.title: EF Core 9 migrations fail with SAP HANA provider due to missing IMigrationsDatabaseLock support
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

We are using SAP HANA Cloud (service type: schema) from an ASP.NET Core application with Entity Framework Core 9 and the Sap.EntityFrameworkCore.Hana provider.

We are facing a blocking issue when using EF Core migrations.

Problem description

When executing migrations (for example, by calling Database.Migrate() during application startup), EF Core throws the following exception:

System.NotSupportedException:
Generating idempotent scripts for migrations is not currently supported for SQLite

The exception occurs in the following method:

IMigrationsDatabaseLock AcquireDatabaseLock()

Important clarification

We were previously using EF Core 6, where migrations worked by generating SQL scripts manually.

The application is correctly connected to SAP HANA Cloud and works properly as long as migrations are not executed.

We are not using SQLite; the error appears to be caused by internal reuse of SQLite migration infrastructure in the HANA provider.

Impact

This makes EF Core migrations unusable with SAP HANA, even when:

  • Using SAP HANA Cloud

  • Using schema-based services

  • Having full DDL permissions

As a result, migrations cannot be applied.

Request / Question

Is there any plan to:

  • Properly implement IMigrationsDatabaseLock for SAP HANA?

  • Remove or replace the SQLite-based fallback in the HANA EF Core provider?

  • Officially support EF Core 9 migrations, even if only partially (as was possible with version 6)?

At the moment, EF Core + HANA can only be safely used as an ORM, not as a schema management tool.

Any guidance, roadmap, or official recommendation would be highly appreciated.

Thanks in advance.

entry.title: Relationship on HANA Cloud Max Connections and CAP DB Connection Pools
entry.content:
Hello,
When two HDI containers that reference the same HANA Cloud instance are used by applications A and B respectively,
if the sum of the DB connections configured in applications A and B exceeds the maximum number of connections internally configured in HANA Cloud (which, as I understand, is SAP-managed and cannot be changed arbitrarily by customers),
could connection timeouts occur?

I expect that this could happen, but I would appreciate hearing others’ opinions, experiences, and any advice on possible solutions.

entry.title: "Unauthorized" error message - Find Data Sources for Calculation View
entry.content:
Hi Experts.

I am working on a simple CAP application were I need to create a Calculation View ( .hdbcalculationview artifact) and when I browse the possible available tables for a Join or a Projection the "Unauthorized" error message appears (see the attached images).

The SAP Hana Cloud is setup via Cloud Central tools and is mapped and running in Cloud Foundry.

Do you know if is due a missing role or something else (HRTT API, SAPID, packages versions, other)?  

Thanks in advance for your support

Eduardo
